item.title: File permissions in Linux
item.description: What are file permissions? In Linux, file permissions, attributes, and ownership control the access level that the system processes and users have to files. This ensures that only authorized users and processes can access specific files and directories. To find out what permissions exist for files & folders in the current directory, do ls -la after the user prompt in the terminal. It is represented by the first ten characters that shows for each file/folder present in the directory.
